snippet: Without ironclad security assurances from America, Israel may well decide to attack Iran on its own.
abstract: Op-Ed article by former chief of Israeli military intelligence Amos Yadlin contends that Israel's window of opportunity to bomb Iran's nuclear facilities, and set back its development of nuclear weapons, is rapidly closing; holds that if the United States expects Israel to refrain from such an attack, it must make ironclad assurances that it is willing to use its own superior military capabilities to prevent a nuclear Iran in the future.
lead_paragraph: Without ironclad security assurances from America, Israel may well decide to attack Iran on its own.

headline.main: Israel’s Last Chance to Strike Iran
